item.title: 在严峻的石油市场形势下，BB 能源公司失去了一半的休斯顿交易员
item.description: 最近几周，BB 能源公司在休斯顿的石油柜台流失了大约一半的交易员，在石油和大宗商品市场环境严峻的情况下，该公司正在进行重组。【原文：BB Energy has lost roughly half of its traders from its Houston oil desk in recent weeks and is reorganizing amid a tough environment for oil and commodity markets.】

item.title: 银行有更多时间对美联储的压力测试变化发表意见
item.description: 美联储同意给大银行更多的时间来权衡关于改进大型金融机构压力测试模型的部分建议。【原文：The Federal Reserve agreed to give big banks more time to weigh in on parts of a proposal to improve stress-test models for large financial institutions.】

item.title: 华尔街加密货币引擎失去动力，ETF 资金流逆转
item.description: 比特币 ETF 的流入量— 曾经是需求的稳定鼓点— 正在消失。对于一个将这些信号视为福音的市场来说，这种转变加剧了人们对加密货币下行的担忧。【原文：Bitcoin ETF inflows — once a steady drumbeat of demand — are vanishing. For a market that treats those signals as gospel, the shift is stoking fears the crypto downdraft has further to go.】

item.title: PrimaLend 债权人阻止向首席执行官控制的公司支付贷款
item.description: 破产汽车经销商贷款公司 PrimaLend Capital Partners 的债权人赢得了暂时停止向该公司首席执行官马克-詹森（Mark Jensen）控制的一家公司支付每月贷款的权利。【原文：Creditors of bankrupt auto-dealership lender PrimaLend Capital Partners won a temporary halt of monthly loan payments to a firm controlled by the company’s Chief Executive Officer Mark Jensen.】

item.title: 巴拉圭将关键利率维持在 6%，重申通胀前景
item.description: 巴拉圭中央银行将基准利率维持在 6%，并重申其预测，即到明年年底通货膨胀率将与目标趋同。【原文：Paraguay’s central bank held its benchmark interest rate at 6%, reiterating its forecast that inflation will converge with its target by the end of next year.】

item.title: 在 "人工智能 "的推动下，亚马逊戒指工人被勒令搬迁
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. 的 Ring 部门已下令将数百名客服人员调往美国和英国的中心枢纽，以在全公司范围内推动业务精简和自动化。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s Ring division has ordered hundreds of customer service workers to relocate to central hubs in the US and UK amid a companywide push to streamline and automate operations.】

item.title: 特朗普团队内部提出向中国出售 Nvidia H200 芯片的想法
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国官员正在就是否允许英伟达公司向中国出售其 H200 人工智能芯片进行早期讨论。【原文：US officials are having early discussions on whether to let Nvidia Corp. sell its H200 artificial intelligence chips to China, according to people familiar with the matter, a contentious potential move that would mark a major win for the world’s most valuable company.】

item.title: 佛罗里达州将没收的中国无人机赠送给军方用于打靶训练
item.description:
美军正在尝试将霰弹枪作为抵御无人机袭击的最后手段。【原文：

US military is trying shotguns as last-ditch defense against drone attacks.

】

item.title: 法兰克福办公楼 Squaire 寻求第二次贷款延期
item.description: 德国最大的办公楼之一 Squaire 的业主们正在寻求第二次延长以大楼为抵押的贷款期限，因为他们要应对租户的离开和估值压力。【原文：The owners of the Squaire, one of Germany’s largest office complexes, are looking to extend loans secured against the building for a second time as they contend with departing tenants and pressure on valuations.】

item.title: Airbnb 称首席技术官巴洛格将离职
item.description: Airbnb Inc.首席技术官阿里-巴洛格（Ari Balogh）在周五提交的一份交易所文件中表示，他计划在12月卸任。【原文：Airbnb Inc. Chief Technology Officer Ari Balogh plans to step aside from his role in December, the company said in an exchange filing on Friday.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟的竞购者都带着监管包袱参加拍卖会
item.description: 据熟悉这一过程的人士称，华纳兄弟发现公司的三家竞购者提出了一系列监管问题，可能会使合并审批推迟一年或更长时间。【原文：The three bidders for Warner Brothers Discovery Inc. present a host of regulatory concerns that could delay a merger approval for a year or more, according to people familiar with the process.】

item.title: 泰克-安格鲁交易获得咨询公司 Glass Lewis 的支持
item.description: 股东咨询公司Glass, Lewis & Co.建议泰克资源有限公司（Teck Resources Ltd.）和英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）的投资者投票支持合并两家矿业公司的交易。【原文：Shareholder advisory firm Glass, Lewis & Co. recommended that investors of Teck Resources Ltd. and Anglo American Plc vote in favor of a deal to combine the mining companies.】

item.title: 两个清洁工如何制作出年度最迷人的 RPG 游戏之一
item.description: 倾销王国》反映了电子游戏开发的民主化。【原文：‘Kingdoms of the Dump’ reflects the democratization of video-game development.】

item.title: 美国铁路公司铁路创纪录，2025 年乘客人数超过 3400 万
item.description: Amtrak 今年的乘客量打破了记录，因为这条全国性铁路在美国各地推出了新的线路，并升级了几节车厢以扩大运力。【原文：Amtrak’s ridership broke records this year after the national railroad introduced new routes across the US and upgraded several cars to expand capacity.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织总裁丹-卡茨计划访华参加第四条谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，国际货币基金组织二号官员丹-卡茨（Dan Katz）将前往中国，参加一个对中国经济进行年度审查的代表团。【原文：The International Monetary Fund’s No. 2 official Dan Katz will travel to China to join a mission conducting an annual review of the country’s economy, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德意志银行盈利大增，黄金交易卷土重来
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）在几乎放弃贵金属交易业务十年后，又开始重返贵金属交易的第一阵营，获得了可观的交易利润，并申请重新加入在市场中发挥核心作用的银行圈。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG is mounting a return to the top table of precious metals trading a decade after it all but abandoned the business, notching up significant trading profits and applying to rejoin the inner circle of banks that play a central role in the market.】

item.title: 美国通胀交易员将利用未经检验的回落来应对缺失的 CPI
item.description: 在史上最长的政府关门导致经济数据收集工作脱轨后，与美国通胀挂钩的 7 万亿美元证券市场将首次采用后备机制。【原文：The $7 trillion market for securities linked to US inflation will employ fallback mechanisms for the first time after the longest government shutdown in history derailed economic data collection.】

item.title: Figma 上市不到四个月就跌破 IPO 发行价
item.description: Figma Inc. 的股价首次短暂跌破其首次公开募股的价格，成为今年高歌猛进的新股中最新一个回调其令人瞠目的早期涨幅的公司。【原文：Figma Inc.’s stock briefly fell below its initial public offering price for the first time, becoming just the latest of this year’s high-flying listings to retrace its eye-popping early gains.】

item.title: 英国债务规则可能对里夫斯的紧缩预算构成更大挑战
item.description: 财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）下周将公布预算案，人们纷纷猜测她将如何满足其主要财政规则，即税收要能覆盖日常支出。但她承诺的债务下降目标可能更难实现。【原文：The build-up to Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ budget next week has been dominated by speculation about how she will satisfy her main fiscal rule to have taxes cover day-to-day spending. But her pledge to get debt falling may prove trickier to meet.】

item.title: 阿布扎比 IHC 公司称对卢克石油海外资产感兴趣
item.description: 阿布扎比国际控股公司（Abu Dhabi's International Holding Co.【原文：Abu Dhabi’s International Holding Co. is exploring a possible acquisition of Lukoil PJSC’s overseas operations, the company said, the latest suitor positioning for opportunities created by Western sanctions on the Russian energy giant.】

item.title: 尼日尔征收新的贸易税以资助打击叛乱分子的战争
item.description: 尼日尔对进出口商品征收新税，以寻求更多资金应对与伊斯兰叛乱分子日益激烈的斗争。【原文：Niger has rolled out new taxes on imported and exported goods as it seeks more funds to fight a growing fight with Islamist insurgents.】

item.title: 智利左翼总统候选人珍妮特-哈拉调整竞选领导层
item.description: 智利左翼总统候选人珍妮特-贾拉（Jeannette Jara）重新调整了竞选团队，引入了前部长、社交媒体影响者和运动员，在下个月的决选前以弱势姿态参与竞争。【原文：Chile leftist presidential candidate Jeannette Jara reshuffled her campaign team, bringing in former ministers, social media influencers and athletes as she competes as an underdog before next month’s runoff.】

item.title: 杰富瑞（Jefferies）称银行从放松管制中获得 26 亿美元额外收益
item.description: 据杰富瑞（Jefferies）分析师称，对美国银行的宽松监管有望为大型金融机构释放约 2.6 万亿美元的贷款能力，从而巩固美国贷款机构相对于欧洲竞争对手的更高估值。【原文：Looser regulation for US banks is expected to unlock some $2.6 trillion in lending capacity for large financial institutions, according to Jefferies analysts, cementing the richer valuation of American lenders over rivals in Europe.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长佩雷拉警告美国市场调整和加密货币构成威胁
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员阿尔瓦罗-桑托斯-佩雷拉警告说，金融市场和加密资产的急剧调整将成为金融稳定面临的最大短期风险之一。【原文：A steep correction in financial markets and crypto assets would rank among the top short-term risks to financial stability, European Central Bank Governing Council member Alvaro Santos Pereira warned.】

item.title: 美国统计局取消 10 月 CPI 报告，11 月数据定于 12 月 18 日发布
item.description: 美国劳工统计局（Bureau of Labor Statistics）取消了 10 月份的消费者价格指数报告，称其无法追溯在美国政府停摆期间没有收集到的一些数据。【原文：The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled its October consumer price index report, saying it was unable to retroactively obtain some data that wasn’t collected during the US government shutdown.】

item.title: 特朗普削减关税或将缓解美国咖啡和牛肉爱好者的痛苦
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）决定取消对巴西咖啡和牛肉征收的关键关税，这可能会给因主要主食价格飙升而苦苦挣扎的市场和美国消费者带来一些宽慰。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s decision to remove a key tariff on Brazilian coffee and beef may deliver some relief to markets and American consumers who have struggled with soaring prices for the key staples.】

item.title: 欧洲央行穆勒认为在可预见的未来通胀率将接近 2
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒表示，他对欧元区的物价压力感到宽松，并表示对进一步的利率行动兴趣不大。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Madis Muller suggested he’s relaxed about euro-area price pressures and indicated little appetite for further interest-rate action.】

item.title: 五角大楼向 Vulcan 公司和 ReElement 公司贷款 7 亿美元用于磁铁生产
item.description: 美国国防部同意向稀土磁铁生产商提供 7 亿美元贷款，以增加消费电子产品和武器所用材料的国内生产。【原文：The US Department of Defense agreed to lend $700 million to producers of rare-earth magnets in a bid to increase domestic production of materials used in consumer electronics and weapons.】

item.title: 为何债券市场将成为英国预算案的重要影响因素
item.description: 当英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）于 11 月 26 日公布英国预算案时，债券市场将迅速做出判断，投资者将决定她是否做了足够多的工作来使英国的债务走上可持续发展的道路。【原文：When Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves unveils the UK budget on Nov. 26, bond markets will quickly pass judgment, with investors deciding whether she’s done enough to put the country’s debt on a sustainable path.】
